name: CrossVolt
description:
WASD to move, mouse to aim, and left click to shoot

Shooting enemies stuns them and connects them to other enemies you shoot in the future. Shooting an outlet or electric panel (white or green objects on the walls) will kill all connected enemies. 

This is my first game jam and I worked alone. I used Godot 3.2.1. I've been learning Godot just since the beginning of quarantine, so about two months. 

The downloadable version does have a small amount of graphical upgrades - be warned that I could only test the Windows export personally.

If you download the Source Project, I apologize for my ridiculous, un-commented, spaghetti code. It's a mess of ad hoc workarounds and abandoned ideas that I never took out for fear that it would break the game.

I have to thank all of the great YouTubers who taught me Godot, especially Miziziziz, HeartBeast, GDquest and Kidscancode. There are many more, but I don't even know who all I referred to in making this game. Also a thank you to anyone who answers Godot questions in the forum. Saved me more time and headaches than I thought possible.
